25161475.trustfund:
TF013056-Administration and Program
            Management of TF071688 by LCSAR,TF013055-Supervision of the TF 71688
            Nicaragua IV Agricultural Census and Public,TF099911-Support to implementation of
            the IV Agricultural Census in Nicaragua,TF071688-Nicaragua 2011 Agricultural
            Census and Public Expenditure Review Trust,TF053139-PHRD-NICARAGUA: AGRICULTURAL
            TECHNOLOGY PROJECT APL II,TF091495-PRICE RISK MANAGEMENT IN HONDURAS

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Agricultural Technology
            Project for Nicaragua received a satisfactory outcome with a
            moderate risk to development outcome. Both the Banks and
            the Borrowers performances were satisfactory. There were
            four restructurings that took place and include the
            following changes: (R1) (i) Reallocation of proceeds, and
            (ii) extension of the closing date of the Credit agreement.
            (R2) Change in the implementing agency for Component 1.C
            (b): The provision of sub credits to finance the carrying
            out of Cooperative Development Plans of the additional
            financing, from the Rural Credit Fund (FCR) to the newly
            created Banco Produzcamos (BP). (R3) Include two additional
            activities under the TF: (i) carry out two post census
            studies; and (ii) produce and publish dissemination
            materials on the Census. The changes were financed with the
            cost savings. (R4) (i) Reallocation of proceeds of the
            Credit No. 4127-NI, and (ii) Reallocation of proceeds and
            first extension of the closing date of the IDA Grant.
            Several lesson were learned from this project and are as
            follows: (1) A sector wide platform to coordinate donors and
            public sector institutions can promote efficient sector
            investment and long-term strategic planning, but brings
            coordination challenges. (2) On-farm diversification
            contributes to boosting incomes. (3) When designing a
            program for certified seeds to increase production, target
            markets, storage facilities and marketing skills for
            increased production need to be considered. (4) Well-aligned
            incentives for rural extension agents are needed to ensure
            proper delivery of technical assistance. (5) Seed
            cooperatives selected for credit should have proven ability
            in both capacity and infrastructure to ensure the most
            effective use of credit lines.

repnme.cdata!:
Nicaragua - Second Agricultural Technology
            Project : implementation support mission - January 21 to 31, 2014

abstracts.cdata!:
This Aide Memoire states that a World
            Bank mission visited Nicaragua between 21 and 31 January
            2014 to support the implementation of the Second
            Agricultural Technology Project on the second agricultural
            technology project of Nicaragua. Together with officials and
            experts from the executing agencies of the project, the
            mission tackled technical aspects related to: (i) closing
            Credit 4127; (ii) progress in implementing the Action Plan
            for additional financing to support the Nacional System of
            seeds; (iii) assess compliance with applicable environmental
            and social safeguards; and (iv) monitoring the fiduciaries
            aspects. The agenda of the mission included field visits
            with the executing agencies, the Representative of the World
            Bank country office and producer organizations of three of
            the four areas of influence of the project in the
            Departments of Jinotega, Matagalpa, Boaco and New Guinea.
            Progress in achieving the development goals of the project
            was deemed to be satisfactory. Overall, the project is
            achieving its development objective of providing rural
            households with greater access to innovation and sustainable
            agricultural and forest services that encourage increased
            agricultural productivity. This Aide Memoire will be made public.

repnme.cdata!:
Nicaragua - Second Agricultural Technology
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Second
            Agricultural Technology Project (ATP-II) for Nicaragua is to
            provide rural households and communities with a broader
            access to sustainable agricultural, forestry and natural
            resource management services and innovations, and to
            stimulate higher productivity. The reallocation of credit
            proceeds will allow for a better distribution of project
            funds (reconciling investments with funds allocations) while
            reinforcing operational capacity of executing agencies to
            achieve the project development objective. The six-month
            extension (until June 30, 2014) and reallocation of grant
            proceeds is necessary to achieve the project development
            objectives. It will allow for completing planned activities
            to improve operational and storage capacity (1,800 metric
            tons) of the National Genetic Center, and inspection
            capacity of the plant health office in the field (3,580
            Ha/year). Also, it will help establish the revolving fund
            (US$3.0 million) by financing the last 25 business plans (12
            of them are already prepared) to another 18 organizations to
            produce the remaining 1,804 metric tons of certified seeds
            to reach the original target.
